00126 /* Structures from another module */
00127 extern nfs_parameter_t           nfs_param ;
00128 extern nfs_worker_data_t       * workers_data ;
00129 extern cache_content_client_t    recover_datacache_client ;
00130 
00131 /* Use the same structure as the worker (but not all the fields will be used) */
00132 nfs_worker_data_t   fcc_gc_data ;
00133 fsal_op_context_t   fsal_context;
00134 
00135 /* Variable used for forcing flush via a signal */
00136 unsigned int force_flush_by_signal ;
00137 
00138 int ___cache_content_invalidate_flushed( LRU_entry_t * plru_entry, void * addparam )
00139 {
00140   cache_content_entry_t   * pentry = NULL ;
00141   cache_content_client_t  * pclient = NULL ; 
00142 
00143   
00144   pentry = (cache_content_entry_t *)plru_entry->buffdata.pdata ;
00145   pclient = (cache_content_client_t *)addparam ;
00146 
00147   if( pentry->local_fs_entry.sync_state != SYNC_OK )   
00148     {
00149       /* Entry is not to be set invalid */
00150       return LRU_LIST_DO_NOT_SET_INVALID ; 
00151     }
00152  
00153   /* Clean up and set the entry invalid */
00154   P( pentry->pentry_inode->lock ) ;   
00155   pentry->pentry_inode->object.file.pentry_content = NULL ;
00156   V( pentry->pentry_inode->lock ) ;   
00157   
00158   /* Release the entry */
00159   RELEASE_PREALLOC( pentry, pclient->pool_entry, next_alloc ) ;
00160 
00161 
00162   /* Retour de la pentry dans le pool */
00163   return LRU_LIST_SET_INVALID ;
00164 } /* cache_content_invalidate_flushed */
00165 
00166 
00167 int file_content_gc_manage_entry( LRU_entry_t * plru_entry, void * addparam )
00168 {
00169   cache_content_entry_t   * pentry = NULL ;
00170   cache_content_status_t    cache_content_status ;
00171   exportlist_t            * pexport = NULL ;
00172 
00173 
00174   pentry = (cache_content_entry_t *)plru_entry->buffdata.pdata ;
00175   pexport = (exportlist_t *)addparam ;
00176  
00177  
00178   if( pentry->local_fs_entry.sync_state == SYNC_OK )
00179     {
00180       /* No flush needed */
00181       return TRUE ;
00182     }
00183   if ( ( cache_content_status = cache_content_flush( pentry, 
00184                                                      CACHE_CONTENT_FLUSH_AND_DELETE,
00185                                                      &fcc_gc_data.cache_content_client, 
00186                                                      &fsal_context, 
00187                                                      &cache_content_status ) ) != CACHE_CONTENT_SUCCESS )                       
00188     {
00189         DisplayLog( "NFS FILE CONTENT GARBAGGE COLLECTION : /!\\ Can't flush %s : error %d",
00190         pentry->local_fs_entry.cache_path_data, cache_content_status ) ;
00191     }
00192 
00193   /* Continue with next entry in LRU_Apply_function */
00194   return TRUE ;
00195 } /* file_content_gc_manage_entry */
00196 
00197 void * file_content_gc_thread( void * IndexArg )
00198 {
00199   long                    index = (long)IndexArg ;
00200   int                     rc = 0 ;
00201   unsigned int            i = 0 ;
00202   cache_content_status_t  cache_content_status ;
00203   exportlist_t          * pexport = NULL ; 
00204   int                     is_hw_reached = FALSE ;
00205   int                     some_work_to_do = FALSE ;
00206   unsigned long           nb_blocks_to_manage ;
00207   char                    cache_sub_dir[MAXPATHLEN] ;
00208   fsal_status_t           fsal_status ;
00209 
00210  
00211   SetNameFunction( "file_content_fc_thread" ) ;
00212 
00213   /* Init signal management */
00214   force_flush_by_signal = FALSE ;
00215 
00216   DisplayLog( "NFS FILE CONTENT GARBAGGE COLLECTION : Starting garbagge thread" ) ;
00217   DisplayLog( "NFS FILE CONTENT GARBAGGE COLLECTION : my pthread id is %p", (caddr_t)pthread_self() ) ;
00218 
00219   /* Initialisation of the Buddy Malloc */
00220 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
00221   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_DEBUG, "NFS FILE CONTENT GARBAGGE COLLECTION : Initialization of memory manager" ) ;
00222 #endif
00223 
00224 #ifndef _NO_BUDDY_SYSTEM
00225   if ( ( rc = BuddyInit( &nfs_param.buddy_param_worker )) != BUDDY_SUCCESS )
00226     {
00227       /* Failed init */
00228       DisplayLog( "NFS FILE CONTENT GARBAGGE COLLECTION : Memory manager could not be initialized, exiting..." ) ;
00229       exit( 1 ) ;
00230     }
00231   DisplayLog( "NFS FILE CONTENT GARBAGGE COLLECTION : Memory manager successfully initialized" ) ;
00232 #endif
00233 
00234   /* Initialisation of credential for current thread */
00235   DisplayLog( "NFS FILE CONTENT GARBAGGE COLLECTION : Initialization of thread's credential" ) ;
00236   if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR( FSAL_InitClientContext( &fcc_gc_data.thread_fsal_context )) )
00237     {
00238       /* Failed init */
00239       DisplayLog( "NFS FILE CONTENT GARBAGGE COLLECTION : Error initing thread's credential" ) ;
00240       exit( 1 ) ;
00241     }
00242 
00243   /* Init the Cache inode client for this worker */
00244   if( cache_inode_client_init( &fcc_gc_data.cache_inode_client,
00245                                nfs_param.cache_layers_param.cache_inode_client_param,
00246                                index, NULL ) )
00247     {
00248       /* Failed init */
00249       DisplayLog( "NFS FILE CONTENT GARBAGGE COLLECTION : Cache Inode client could not be initialized, exiting..." ) ;
00250       exit( 1 ) ;
00251     }
00252   DisplayLog( "NFS FILE CONTENT GARBAGGE COLLECTION : Cache Inode client successfully initialized" ) ;
00253 
00254   /* Init the Cache content client for this worker */
00255   if( cache_content_client_init( &fcc_gc_data.cache_content_client,
00256                                  nfs_param.cache_layers_param.cache_content_client_param ) )
00257     {
00258       /* Failed init */
00259       DisplayLog( "NFS FILE CONTENT GARBAGGE COLLECTION : Cache Content client could not be initialized, exiting..." ) ;
00260       exit( 1 ) ;
00261     }
00262   DisplayLog( "NFS FILE CONTENT GARBAGGE COLLECTION : Cache Content client successfully initialized" ) ;
00263 
00264 
00265  /* Thread main loop */
00266  while( 1 ) 
00267    {
00268         DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "NFS FILE CONTENT GARBAGGE COLLECTION : sleeping..." ) ;
00269 
00270         /* Sleep until some work is to be done */
00271         sleep( nfs_param.cache_layers_param.dcgcpol.run_interval ) ; 
00272 
00273         DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "NFS FILE CONTENT GARBAGGE COLLECTION : awakening..." ) ;
00274 
00275 
00276         /* Check available space in the data cache */
00277         some_work_to_do = FALSE ;
00278 
00279         for( pexport = nfs_param.pexportlist ; pexport != NULL ; pexport = pexport->next )
00280           {
00281             if( pexport->options & EXPORT_OPTION_USE_DATACACHE )
00282              {
00283                 snprintf( cache_sub_dir, MAXPATHLEN, "%s/export_id=%d",
00284                           nfs_param.cache_layers_param.cache_content_client_param.cache_dir, 0 ) ;
00285           
00286                 if( ( cache_content_status = cache_content_check_threshold( cache_sub_dir,
00287                                                                             nfs_param.cache_layers_param.dcgcpol.lwmark_df,
00288                                                                             nfs_param.cache_layers_param.dcgcpol.hwmark_df,
00289                                                                             &is_hw_reached, 
00290                                                                             &nb_blocks_to_manage ) ) == CACHE_CONTENT_SUCCESS )
00291                   {
00292                         if( is_hw_reached )     
00293                            {
00294                                 DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, 
00295                                                  "NFS FILE CONTENT GARBAGGE COLLECTION : High Water Mark is  reached, %llu blocks to be removed",
00296                                                  nb_blocks_to_manage ) ;
00297                                 some_work_to_do = TRUE ;
00298                            }
00299                         else
00300                                 DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "NFS FILE CONTENT GARBAGGE COLLECTION : High Water Mark is not reached" ) ;
00301  
00302                         /* Use signal management */
00303                         if( force_flush_by_signal == TRUE )
00304                            some_work_to_do = TRUE ;
00305 
00306                         /* Do I have some work to do ? */
00307                         if( some_work_to_do == TRUE )
00308                           {
00309 
00310                             fsal_status = FSAL_GetClientContext( &fsal_context, &pexport->FS_export_context, 0, -1 , NULL, 0 );
00311                             if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR( fsal_status ) )
00312                               {
00313                                 DisplayErrorLog( ERR_FSAL, fsal_status.major, fsal_status.minor);
00314                                 continue ;
00315                               }
00316 
00317                             DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "NFS FILE CONTENT GARBAGGE COLLECTION : about to manage LRU for file content cache entries" ) ;
00318                             for( i = 0 ; i <  nfs_param.core_param.nb_worker ; i++ )
00319                               {
00320                                  DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "NFS FILE CONTENT GARBAGGE COLLECTION : Working on data for thread %u", i ) ;
00321                  
00322                                  if( LRU_apply_function( workers_data[i].cache_content_client.lru_gc, file_content_gc_manage_entry, (void *)pexport  )  != LRU_LIST_SUCCESS )
00323                                  {
00324                                          DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "NFS FILE CONTENT GARBAGGE COLLECTION : Can't access LRU GC for worker %u", i ) ;
00325                                  }
00326 
00327                               }
00328 
00329                             /* some data could have been recovered at startup, manage them as well */
00330                             DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "NFS FILE CONTENT GARBAGGE COLLECTION : Working on crash recoverd data" ) ;
00331 
00332                             if( LRU_apply_function( recover_datacache_client.lru_gc, file_content_gc_manage_entry, (void *)pexport )  != LRU_LIST_SUCCESS )
00333                              {
00334                                 DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "NFS FILE CONTENT GARBAGGE COLLECTION : Can't access LRU GC for recoverd data" ) ;
00335                              }
00336 
00337                           }
00338                   }
00339                 else
00340                   DisplayLog( "NFS FILE CONTENT GARBAGGE COLLECTION : /!\\ Can't get threshold status for export entry %d", pexport->id ) ;
00341 
00342              }
00343           }
00344 
00345         if( LRU_invalidate_by_function( recover_datacache_client.lru_gc, cache_content_invalidate_flushed, (void*)&fcc_gc_data.cache_content_client ) != LRU_LIST_SUCCESS )
00346           {
00347                  DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "NFS FILE CONTENT GARBAGGE COLLECTION : Can't invalidate LRU GC for recoverd data" ) ;
00348           }
00349    
00350          /* Removes the LRU entries and put them back to the pool */
00351          if( LRU_gc_invalid( recover_datacache_client.lru_gc, NULL ) != LRU_LIST_SUCCESS )
00352             {
00353               DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "NFS FILE CONTENT GARBAGGE COLLECTION : Can't remove invalid entries LRU GC for recoverd data" ) ;
00354             }
00355    }
00356 
00357   return NULL ;
00358 } /* file_content_gc_thread */
